definitions.definition: ( ergative ) To chafe , to rub or subject to friction ; to create a sore on the skin.
( transitive , figurative ) To bother or trouble .
( transitive , figurative ) To harass , to harry , often with the intent to cause injury.
( transitive , technical ) To cause pitting on a surface being cut from the friction between the two surfaces exceeding the bond of the material at a point.
examples: Improper cooling and a dull milling cutter on titanium can gall the surface.

definitions.definition: ( intransitive , obsolete , rare ) To scoff ; to jeer .

main_definition: ( ergative ) To chafe , to rub or subject to friction ; to create a sore on the skin.
secondary_definitions: ( transitive , figurative ) To bother or trouble .
( transitive , figurative ) To harass , to harry , often with the intent to cause injury.
( transitive , technical ) To cause pitting on a surface being cut from the friction between the two surfaces exceeding the bond of the material at a point.
( intransitive , obsolete , rare ) To scoff ; to jeer .

definitions.definition: To impregnate with a decoction of gallnuts in dyeing .

main_definition: ( transitive ) To impregnate with a decoction of gallnuts in dyeing .
